alert.note: Alert for Northern Dona Ana County; Sierra County Lakes (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 12:32PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Sierra and northwestern Dona Ana Counties through 115 PM MDT... At 1232 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Derry, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Upham, Arrey, Caballo, Truth or Consequences, Derry, Salem, Garfield, Engle, Cutter, City of Elephant Butte, Palomas, Spaceport America, Elephant Butte Lake, Lost Canyon, Ash Canyon, Rock Canyon, Hot Springs Landing, Lakeshore Highlands, Lower Animas Creek, and Caballo Lake. This includes Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 42 and 68, and between mile markers 75 and 77. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northern Dona Ana County; Sierra County Lakes
